group_works.title: Handling and care of the patient

results.title: Spinal anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Deals with the general principles of administering the spinal anaesthetic. Two techniques are shown: the first using solutions heavier than cerebro-spinal fluid, and the second using solutions lighter than cerebro-spinal fluid. Their practical application is shown, using nupercaine as the anaesthetic agent.

results.title: Nitrous oxide, oxygen, ether, anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
This film shows the working of a typical apparatus designed to deliver a continuous flow on nitrous oxide to the patient. Ether in varied quantities can be added to the mixture of gases as required. One animated diagram sequence in the film deals with the way in which the machine works; another deals with the principle of re-breathing. Induction and maintenance of anaesthesia are demonstrated with emphasis rather on the use of the machine than on general principles.

results.title: The Storymakers
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A series about well-known Australian writers and illustrators of children’s books. It is designed to develop children’s awareness of how books are conceived and created and to encourage a love for books and reading.

results.title: The Illustrators
results.creator_credit: Martin Daley, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
We all know that illustrators make pictures. But are they also story makers? Indeed they are! This program shows how illustrators add to the written word, how pictures tell a story. It is also about the process of making picture books. Features Julie Vivas, Roland Harvey and Jeannie Baker.

results.title: Robin Klein
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
In this video, Robin Klein one of Australia’s most prolific and popular authors, discusses the process of writing a book and the ways she collects ideas. Scenes form “Penny Pollard’s Diary” are interspersed with Robin describing her craft as a writer.

results.title: Colin Thiele
results.creator_credit: Aviva Ziegler, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
Storymakers is a series which highlights different aspects of the process of creating a book and is designed to develop children’s awareness of how books are conceived and created, and to encourage a love of books and reading. In this video, school student, Jonathen Appleton, visits author Colin Thiele to discuss the craft of writing. This program features some scenes from his novels including the classic “Storm Boy”, “The Sun on the Stubble” and the newly published “Jodie’s Journey”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aviva Ziegler, Paul Humfress and Film Australia

results.title: Percy Trezise & Dick Roughsey: a journey to Quinkin country
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
This program shows how the writer-artist team, Percy Trezise and Dick Roughsey came to produce their brilliant award-winning picture book series based on the Aboriginal legends of Cape York. The program follows Kylie Belling, an Aboriginal actress, as she takes a trip to Quinkin country to meet Percy Trezise in North Queensland where he takes the viewer to see the Aboriginal rock paintings that inspired him. We also learn of his blood brother relationship with Dick Roughsey, the Aboriginal artist.
